name: 科學教育研究特論
description: The purpose of this course is to familiarize students with advanced ideas about the technicalities behind conducting good research in science and mathematics education. One of the main objectives of the course is to equip students with the ability to design rigorous research and be able to criticize research articles at a scholarly level. This course is particularly designed for Ph. D. students and the instruction will be conducted in English.
goals: Understand research issues in science education
Understand the correct use of research methodology
Acquire the ability to perform and interpret basic statistical results
Acquire the ability to write research report
syllabus:
Possible topics to be covered this semester will include:

1.    What is research? What is sciences research? What is science education research?

2.    History of educational research and area of research

3.    Ethic issues of educational research

4.    Variables and terminology

5.    Research purpose, research questions and research hypotheses

6.    Literature review: the why, the what and the how

7.    The concept and the importance of research design

8.    Experimental design, quasi-experimental design

9.    Randomization, internal validity and external validity

10\. Qualitative research

11\. Mixed research, Action research

12\. Design research

13\. Research instrumentation design

14\. Reliability

15\. Validity: factor analysis

16\. Abstract and structured abstract, critic of research study

17\. What to report in research and the APA style

18\. Meta analysis

methodologies.note: Individual problem solving and by groups
Computer assisted instruction and statistical software

grading.note: Final report at the end of semester
